Content:
CITES Certificate
For shipments from Germany to India involving endangered species (e.g., exotic leather), send a CITES Certificate via Express to clear Indian customs.
SED (New Electronic Export System)
For exports from Germany, submit an electronic declaration to German customs. You’ll get an Export Accompanying Document (EAD) with a Movement Reference Number (MRN) to include with the shipment—UPS handles EU exit clearance. Informal declarations are allowed up to EUR 1,000 unless restricted (e.g., embargoed goods)—UPS clears these at exit. For shipments EUR 1,001-3,000 leaving by air, declarations can go directly to the exit customs office. UPS offers free formal declarations for German account holders—allow one working day for processing. See www.ups.com/de or https://ups.atlas-netz.de/ for self-service options.
Know Your Customer and POA
German exporters must ensure Indian importers provide Know Your Customer (KYC) documents (e.g., PAN card) and a Power of Attorney (POA) to UPS before clearance—mandatory for all non-document shipments.
Packing List
For multi-package shipments from Germany, include a packing list with the invoice or combine them into one detailed document.
MSDS-NON DG
Goods under IATA Special Provisions A67 (e.g., batteries) need a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS). Include an MSDS or Non-Dangerous Goods (NON DG) declaration—upload to IDIS—especially if transiting via UAE, to avoid delays.
Info About Section Header: Paperwork needed for shipping from Germany to India.
Simplified Form: - **CITES Certificate**: For wildlife items, send via Express from Germany.
- **SED**: File electronically in Germany; get EAD with MRN—UPS clears at EU exit.
- **Informal**: Up to EUR 1,000, use invoice—EUR 1,001-3,000 by air goes to exit customs.
- **UPS Service**: Free declarations—allow a day; check ups.com/de or atlas-netz.de.
- **KYC and POA**: Indian buyer must give UPS ID and permission—required for all non-documents.
- **Packing List**: Multi-packages need a list with invoice or combined.
- **MSDS/NON DG**: For batteries, include MSDS or NON DG—upload to IDIS, especially via UAE.

Content:
Post Office Boxes
No P.O. Box delivery in India—provide a full address and phone (mandatory for non-documents) for KYC.
Gifts & Samples
Label ‘Gift’ or ‘Sample’ on invoices—samples under INR 10,000 (~EUR 110) may be duty-free; gifts face duties since Dec 2019.
MRP Labeling
Retail goods from Germany must show Maximum Retail Price (MRP), product name, import date, importer details, and quantity.
Clearance Comments
From Germany, only documents go in a Docs Bag—non-documents (e.g., CDs) need a Non-DOC Bag, or face Indian customs fines.
Master Air Waybill (MAWB)
Chemicals or valuables (e.g., diamond powder) need an MAWB for cargo clearance.
Airfreight Routing
Shipments land in Mumbai, then move to Calcutta (East), Bangalore (Karnataka), Delhi (North), Chennai/Hyderabad/Cochin (South), or stay in Mumbai—consignee can clear at transit.
Cargo Arrival Notice (CAN)
UPS India sends a CAN—consignee picks their broker or UPS’s.
Duty and Taxes
Non-refundable—if refused, costs bill back to Germany.
Custom Requirements
Upload a valid air waybill to IDIS with invoice—missing docs cause delays and fees.
Customs Clearance Process
Consignee needs an IEC and GST number for commercial goods—clear within 30 days or shipment is abandoned.
E-Way Bill
Goods over INR 50,000 (~EUR 550) moving across Indian states need an E-Way Bill—importer provides, UPS Germany assists.
Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS)
Some German goods (e.g., electronics) need BIS certification—check https://bis.gov.in.
Simplified Form: - **No P.O. Boxes**: Full address and phone for KYC.
- **Gifts/Samples**: Mark them—samples under EUR 110 may skip duty, gifts don’t.
- **MRP**: Retail items need price, name, date, importer info.
- **Docs Only**: Papers in Docs Bag—others in Non-DOC or get fined.
- **Routing**: Lands in Mumbai, then regional airports—or clear at transit.
- **Duties**: Receiver skips? You pay in Germany—no refunds.
- **Air Waybill**: Upload to IDIS with invoice—or face delays.
- **E-Way Bill**: Over EUR 550 across states? Importer needs it—UPS Germany helps.

Content: Service from Germany to India covers select cities—check INTLDI Time in Transit with Indian postal codes. No service to Andaman and Nicobar Islands or Lakshadweep. Provide a full address and phone (mandatory for non-documents). Rest days: Sundays and Indian holidays. Time zone: GMT +5:50. Language: English. Currency: INR.
Simplified Form: - **Coverage**: Ships to select cities—verify with INTLDI.

Content:
Duties and Taxes
Bill to Germany, India, or a third party (needs name, country, account)—outside India adds a surcharge.
Shipping Charges
Bill to Germany, India (with account), or a third party (details needed). No COD—use Free Domicile (F/D).
Payment Methods
Card, check, or cash bills only Germany.
Split Duty and VAT (SDV)
Freight/duties to Germany or third party, taxes to India or third party—surcharge applies.
Third-Party Billing
India-only shipments can’t bill to Germany unless EU-based with VAT ID.
Simplified Form: - **Duties/Taxes**: Bill to Germany, India, or third party—outside India adds fee.
- **Shipping**: Bill to Germany, India (needs account), or third party—no COD, use F/D.
- **Split Billing**: Freight to Germany, taxes to India—extra charge.
- **Third-Party**: India-only can’t bill Germany unless EU with VAT.

Content:
Medical Items
German medical goods need a Health Department NOC on arrival—personal use too. UPS India helps with docs; expect 2-3 day delays. Lab equipment needs a catalog.
Radios
Require an Indian Wireless Planning Wing license.
Televisions
Color TVs need a DGFT license, Cargo only.
Jewelry
Gold/silver up to USD 2,500 via Cargo with MAWB—Courier banned. Non-precious (e.g., brass) is fine.
Leather Goods
Need a Wildlife NOC and origin certificate.
Toys
Need safety certificates (e.g., EN71)—tested by NABL labs.
Telecom Equipment
Phones need IMEI on device and invoice, DOT-registered.
Satellite Equipment
Needs a Wireless Planning Wing license and NOC.
Chemicals
Include MSDS and analysis—customs may test.
Clothing
Needs a dye test certificate from Germany—EU exempt from Azo dye tests.
Nutritional Supplements
Require a Drug Controller NOC.
Drugs/Medicine
Need an Assistant Drug Controller NOC—use scientific names.
Brochures
With samples? Dutiable.
Medicine
NOC required—scientific names on invoice.
RSA Tokens
Dutiable—show real value.
SIM Cards
Resale needs a DOT NOC.
Food
Needs an FSSAI NOC—personal use requires passport.
Personal Imports
C2C: 77% duty; B2C: 43% with proof.
Textiles
Need a dye certificate from Germany or India.
Vitamins
NOC required—use scientific names.
Phones
IMEI mandatory.
Catalogs
Dutiable—not samples.
Tapes
Films need a synopsis—expect duties.
Pakistan Goods
200% duty if routed via Germany.
Info About Section Header: Special rules for goods from Germany to India.
Simplified Form: - **Medical**: NOC needed—UPS aids, delays 2-3 days. Lab gear needs catalog.
- **Jewelry**: Up to USD 2,500 via Cargo—non-precious OK.

Content: No gift exemption from Germany to India—duties apply at 0 INR. Banned gifts: perishables, plants, precious stones, gold, silver, supplements, drugs, cosmetics, confectionery, fruits, veggies, spices, honey, chocolate, tinned food, meat, milk, commercial meds. Personal use needs customs approval. Duty: 77% on assessable value (invoice + freight + insurance).
Simplified Form: - **Banned**: No perishables, plants, gold, supplements, drugs, candy, fruits, spices, honey, chocolate, tinned, meat, milk, meds.

Content:
Paperless Invoice - Imports
India accepts UPS Paperless Invoice for small packages from Germany.
Paperless Invoice - Exports
Available for small package exports from Germany.
Invoice Details
Include: German exporter’s name/address/contact, Indian importer’s name (matching KYC), phone, email, address, invoice number/date, goods description, HS Code, origin (Germany), quantity, price, total, Incoterms (e.g., CIF), purpose, and costs.
Simplified Form: - **Paperless Imports**: India OKs it for small packages.
- **Details**: List German sender, Indian receiver (per KYC), phone, email, address, invoice info, HS Code, Germany origin, prices, Incoterms, purpose, costs.

Content: From Germany, up to 2 kg: bonds, cash letters, manuscripts, tickets, reports, bids, blank forms, blueprints, charts, print-outs, intercompany mail, price lists, proposals, seismic data, spec sheets, used traveler’s checks, visa apps (to embassies), graphs, Mylars. Blank checks restricted. UPS Germany offers forms online/print.
Simplified Form: - **Documents**: Up to 2 kg—bonds, letters, manuscripts, tickets, reports, bids, forms, blueprints, charts, print-outs, mail, prices, proposals, seismic, specs, used checks, visas (embassies), graphs, Mylars.
- **Forms**: Get from UPS Germany online or print.

Content:
Samples
Max 5 pieces from Germany—Mumbai bans duty-free; Bangalore/Delhi may allow it.
Prohibited Gifts
No perishables, plants, stones, gold, silver, supplements, drugs, cosmetics, confectionery, fruits, veggies, spices, honey, chocolate, tinned food, meat, milk, meds—personal use needs approval.
Antiques
Restricted from Germany—needs ISC contract.
Computers
Laptops/PCs (HSN 8741) need a Restricted Import License.
Maps
Incorrect India borders banned.
Seeds
Need a Plant Quarantine NOC—Cargo only.
Precious Items
Stones, gold, silver via Cargo only.
Animals
Banned.
Used Items
Banned without SIL.
Artwork
Restricted from Germany—needs ISC; must be recent, appraised.
Perishables
Cargo only with NOCs (e.g., FSSAI).
Guns
Banned—exceptions for licensed shooters or film with MHA NOC.
Passports
Embassies only.
E-Cigarettes
Fully banned.
Batteries
UN3480 banned by airlines; metal batteries restricted.
Publications
Incorrect India maps banned.
Used Electronics
Need MOEF NOC.
Drones
Banned unless with DGCA clearance, airworthiness cert, SIL.
Plastics
Single-use banned since July 2022 (e.g., straws).
Plants
Banned.
Personal Effects
Cargo only with passport, visa, ticket, 6-month travel history.
Info About Section Header: Banned or restricted items from Germany to India.
Simplified Form: - **Samples**: Max 5—Mumbai dutiable, others may not be.
- **Banned Gifts**: No perishables, plants, gold, supplements, drugs, candy, fruits, spices, honey, chocolate, tinned, meat, milk, meds.

Content: Check Calculate Time and Cost for Germany-to-India service details. Options: UPS Worldwide Express Saver, Expedited, Express Freight, Economy DDU, Economy DDP, Express, Freight Midday, Express Plus. Not all reach every Indian address.
Info About Section Header: Shipping services from Germany to India.
Simplified Form: - **Check Tool**: Use Calculate Time and Cost.
- **Options**: Express Saver, Expedited, Freight, Economy DDU/DDP, Express, Freight Midday, Express Plus.

Content:
Ata Carnet
Temporary exhibition goods from Germany—re-export in 6 months.
Triptyque
Vehicles duty-free for 6 months (extendable) with auto club membership.
Raw Materials
Duty-free from Germany for processing—claim drawback on re-export.
Samples
Under INR 10,000 (~EUR 110), mark ‘SAMPLES – FREE OF COST’ for duty-free.
Wood Packing
Use ISPM 15-treated wood over 6mm.
Repair and Return
Invoices need details, origin (Germany), value, ‘Repair and Return’—duty on repair costs.
Personal Shipments
C2C: 35% duty (10% with proof); B2C: 10% with proof, 35% without (77.28% for gifts).
Gifts
All dutiable.
Simplified Form: - **Samples**: Under EUR 110, label ‘FREE’ for no duty.
- **Personal**: C2C 35% (10% with proof); B2C 10% with proof, 35% without (77% for gifts).

Content: No de minimis value from Germany to India—duties apply at 0 INR.
Max weight: 70 kg (150 lbs). Max length: 274 cm (107.9 in). Max dimensions: 400 cm (157.5 in) combined (length + girth).
